reviewText: These videos are divided so you can work on the areas that you really want and they are fast. I am actually using this product.
summary: easy to watch, easy to do
Title: Joel Harper's FIT PACK

reviewText: Excellent, excellent, excellent. I feel that these exercises do my body much more good than any kind of working out with weights or gym equipment would ever do. You have to remember that the goal of working out is to increase your strength, flexibility and endurance without *damaging* your body. The exercises here are pretty darn strenuous but without weights. There's one workout that's pretty much dedicated to pushups and the guy doing the "medium difficulty" - who I believe is an ex-Olympic athlete? - cannot keep up with Joel Harper at all.I've had this video for a couple years, I've done all the exercises except the cardio, because I get my carido from walking and hiking. But my athlete friend who does yoga says the cardio one is intense.
Title: Joel Harper's FIT PACK

reviewText: I would like to try this DVD, but seems rather expensive considering I can get other great workouts of similar length for under $15! Can anyone explain why Joel's workout is worth the high price?
Title: Joel Harper's FIT PACK

reviewText: For every person of limited means, time and space who has had to listen to someone tell them that they won't be able to get in shape unless they spend hundreds of dollars on gym memberships and/or large (or small) home equipment as well as devote over an hour per day- this is for you.Fit Pack has nine different workouts that clock in at 30 minutes or under- for the most part, under.  Included are workouts for Chest, Back, Shoulders, Abs (two of them), Legs, Buns/Glutes, Cardio and a Combo workout that has a little bit of everything.  The only "equipment" required is a mat (which you could get away with not using for most of them) and sneakers for the Cardio workout.  I really, really like the workout choices Harper made.  If you've got something of a gym mentality, you can work your body parts by day, starting with maybe Chest on Day 1, Back on Day 2, Shoulders on Day 3, etc. without overworking your muscles (and since you're using your gravity and your body weight only, that would be unlikely in any case).  Or if you're looking for a total body workout, you can use the Combo workout or combine some of the other workouts if you want a longer workout.  It's very flexible.Harper clearly has a yoga practice of his own.  Many of the exercises, particularly for the upper body, have recognizable yoga postures and movements- some Down Dog variations for the Chest, Cat extensions for the back, and some tough Side Planks for the Shoulders.  In addition to integrating yoga into calisthenics, he also adds some twists I've never seen before (and I've been using "the latest and greatest" at home for quite some time).  I found many of his Leg exercises to be very innovative, particularly his take on the One-Legged Deadlift.  That move is always a killer, but he found a way to make it that much harder.The Chest, Back, Legs and Advanced Abs had me near tears.  I'm a proud, stubborn person, but I dropped some of the reps on the pushups and a whole bunch on the Advanced Abs.  Even with that, I have to say that the Advanced Abs was the hardest abdominal workout I have ever done.  I have not felt that worked over- for days afterwards- since my very first Pilates class.  Tough, tough, tough.The Abs, Buns and Cardio workouts are shorter than the others, between 17/18 (Abs) and 6 (Cardio).  I would recommend using those in combination or adding them onto the other, longer workouts (or just doing them on their own- as I said, the Abs are tough).  The Buns workout is also pretty difficult; I felt that for about two days as well.  Actually, the Chest workout is about the same length as the Abs, but I'd recommend treating that as a standalone workout that complements the Back workout, since it works your Chest pretty hard.Here's hoping that this isn't the last we see of Harper and his no-equipment, no-time workouts.  If there is a volume 2, I'd love to see: longer, lower-impact cardio (this one has a lot of jogging and high impact, and sometimes my downstairs neighbors just aren't as accommodating as they could be); a Combo 2; and a stretch routine (which, given the yoga, shouldn't be too hard).  But in the meantime, this release should keep me plenty busy.
Title: Joel Harper's FIT PACK

reviewText: I totally dig this dvd. 1) No equipment needed, just your body. 2) Time flexibility and you mix and match the workouts. 3) Love the yoga influence.  And, $29.99 is not so much for nine, yes 9 workouts.
Title: Joel Harper's FIT PACK

reviewText: I have tried 3 of Joel's free online workouts. They are pretty good , but pretty much the same.I assumed that the DVD would be reasonably priced, but it is not. Some of the best workout DVDs ever created are less than half the price.On top of that is completely breaks with the ethos of "you on a diet" which encourages the free distribution the book based workout.I am not suggesting that Joel's DVD should be free, but $29.99 plus tax and shipping is more than I will part with.(keep in mind you can get 3 x 20 mins of Joel's workouts legally free online)Edit still a good work out and as I get older I am glad of it... (2012)
Title: Joel Harper's FIT PACK

reviewText: These 9 short workouts work the whole body with no equipment needed.  Many of the workouts have different intensity levels from easy to hard.  One may work up from easier versions to more intense versions of exercises. I loved the abs & legs sections which are fairly intense.  Note that the short cardio section is high impact with a lot of jumps and you may want to modify or set up your own low impact cardio program like walking outside or getting an indoor walking DVD.  For many people, these workouts will add variety to your exercise program.Here's the breakdown for the 9 workouts.1. Shoulders (about 20 minutes) beginner, intermediate, and advancedExercises include arm & hand movements, planks, stretches, and so on.2. Cardio (about 6 minutes) for all levelsThis very short cardio is high impact, meaning a lot of jumping.3. Buns (about 10 minutes) for all levelsAll work is done on the ground (floor) as opposed to standing.4. Abs (about 17 minutes) beginner and intermediateProbably more of an intermediate abs program, you do what you can do and build yourself up over time.  This contains crunch variations, stretches, including work on the lower abs and the obliques (sides).5. Abs (about 16 minutes) advancedThis contains an unique twisting or rotating exercise which I have only seen on this workout.6. Chest (about 15 minutes) beginner, intermediate, and advancedExercises include arm & hand movements, pushup variations, and stretches.7. Combo (about 30 minutes) beginner, intermediate, and advancedExercises involve arm & hand movements, stretches, pushups, back movements, leg movements, crunches, and holding positions.8. Back (about 22 minutes) beginner, intermediate, and advancedExercises include back, arm & leg movements, along with holding positions and stretches.9. Leg (about 29 minutes) beginner, intermediate, and advancedThis one may be intense and it has balance work.  It includes holding positions, leg movements, stretches, balance movements on one leg, squats, and calf raises.Here is a little more detail regarding the levels.  Most workouts have a beginner, an intermediate, and an advanced version.  The advanced version may involve balancing on one leg so it may be more appropriately called a more intense version of the intermediate workout.  For example, lift one leg to make it more intense and lift it up higher for even more intensity.  So, balance work is covered in some of these workouts.The upper body workouts are a bit different from other workouts and may involve  circling the arms and other arm and hand movements.In addition, quite a few stretches are integrated throughout these workouts to aid you in getting more limber and flexible.
Title: Joel Harper's FIT PACK

reviewText: I just did the shoulder exercises and they were great!  I have right shoulder pain and these exercises really stretched out the knots and relieved the pains.  I will definitely add one of these workouts to my routines everyday.  Thanks for the no nonsense workouts!.
Title: Joel Harper's FIT PACK
